thread.title: Actor Randy Quaid, wife in custody
thread.title_full: Actor Randy Quaid, wife in custody

title: Actor Randy Quaid, wife in custody
text:
Actor Randy Quaid, wife in custody Couple tried to enter U.S. from Canada Published 11:56 PM EDT Oct 10, 2015 Vermont State Police via CNN Photos Vermont State Police via CNN 
An attempt by actor Randy Quaid and his wife to re-enter the United States from Canada, where they'd lived in recent years because of legal issues, ended with them in custody, Vermont State Police said. Ex-staffer: Benghazi committee has... 
The couple were detained Friday night as they tried to cross at the port of entry at Highgate Springs, Vermont, The Associated Press reported. 
Quaid, who is wanted in Santa Barbara, California, on 5-year-old felony vandalism charges brought after he and his wife, Evi, were discovered living in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned without the current owner's permission, told the AP he wants to take care of those legal matters and "move on with his life." 
A judge set bail at $500,000 for each of them. The 65-year-old Quaid was being held at the North West State Correctional Center and his wife was housed at the Chittenden Regional Correctional Facility. 
The CBC reported that the "Independence Day" and "National Lampoon's Vacation" actor was ordered to leave Canada by Oct. 14. He had been arrested by the Canadian Border Service Agency for being a potential flight risk. 
The Quaids had applied for refugee status in Canada in 2010, contending they were being persecuted in the United States, the network said. They also claimed they were possible targets of "Hollywood star-whackers" who sought to kill actors.
